metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17133 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In the Linux kernel through 5.3.2, cfg80211_mgd_wext_giwessid in net/wireless/wext-sme.c does not reject a long SSID IE, leading to a Buffer Overflow. Nicolas Waisman discovered that the WiFi driver stack in the Linux kernel did not properly validate SSID lengths. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

notes.Note: sbeattie> 4ac2813cc867ae563a1ba5a9414bfb554e5796fa would be a good secondary line of defense

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
